New Records: The referee showed 18 cards in total, two red and 16 yellow, to set a new Euros record.
Key Match Events: Antonín Barák was given a red card in the 20th minute for a harsh second yellow card.
Hakan Çalhanoglu scored a goal in the 51st minute.
Tomás Soucek scored a goal for Czechia in the 66th minute.
Cenk Tosun scored a goal for Turkey in stoppage time.
Post-Match Reflections: Tomás Soucek lamented the soft red card and its impact on the game.
Mert Muldur and Baris Alper Yilmaz expressed their happiness and improvement from past performances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in a hot atmosphere with Turkish fans outnumbering the Czechs thanks to their huge diaspora in Germany.
Jindrich Stanek, the Czech goalkeeper, appeared to hurt his shoulder with a save just before Çalhanoglu's goal and went off injured after the goal.
Others: Turkey finished second behind Portugal in Group F on goal difference and will play Austria in the last 16 on July 2 in Leipzig.
The Czechs finished bottom of the group with one point.
